Description: Eleven fragments, eight joining, from the rim and top of a large East Greek pottery bucchero lid. Carinated wall above flat rim; light grooving above rim and two grooves on wall. To the centre a handle scar with a knob between two spurs at the attachment. Inner part has peeled off almost all of one sherd. Possible traces of graffito on one loose sherd. Exterior glossy black, if worn; interior rough and grey.
Dimensions: Width: 4.20 centimetres (of handle at join to body)
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 91) (taken as from a bowl or dinos, but revised by her as from a lid in Leclere and Spencer 2014)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (119) (recognised as a lid by Sabine Weber)
